_comment: Created by rreed on 06/07/2017 08:50:18 using v2.7
title: How has HbA1c target achievement for children with diabetes changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
HbA1c levels less than 58 mmol/mol suggest excellent control of diabetes and levels over 80 mmol/mol can lead to serious lifetime complications.

There has been a slight increase in the proportion of children in England and Wales with HbA1c <58mmol/mol in the last year to 26.6%. At the same time there has been a slight decline in the proportion of those who have HbA1c over 80mmol/mol from 28.7% in 2011/12 to 17.9% in 2015/16; however this figure still suggests almost one fifth of children and young people with diabetes have unacceptably high HbA1c.

Updated June 2017.
data_source: Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health, National Paediatric Diabetes Audit
